name: Puppy Linux 10
install_guide_markdown:
# Puppy Linux 10 Installation Guide

## Prerequisites
- 256MB RAM minimum (for live system)
- 512MB for installation
- USB drive (1GB+) or CD
- Old computers or embedded systems

## Step 1: Download ISO
Get Fossapup64 from puppy-linux.org

## Step 2: Create Bootable Media
Burn to CD or write to USB

## Step 3: Boot from Media
Restart computer and boot from USB/CD

## Step 4: Run as Live System
Puppy boots entirely to RAM, no installation needed

## Step 5: Persistent Storage (Optional)
Create save file for persistent changes across reboots

## Usage
Works great on old computers, netbooks, and USB sticks

install_steps.title: Download Fossapup64 ISO
install_steps.detail_md: Get Fossapup64 10.0.1 (850MB) from official puppy mirror.

install_steps.title: Create Bootable Media
install_steps.detail_md:
Write ISO to USB:
```
sudo dd if=fossapup64-10.0.1.iso of=/dev/sdX bs=4M
```
Or burn to CD

install_steps.title: Boot Live System
install_steps.detail_md: Insert media and reboot. Puppy loads entirely into RAM (256MB-512MB). No installation needed for live use.

install_steps.title: Frugal Installation (Optional)
install_steps.detail_md: For persistent storage, create a save file (.sfs) or frugal install to hard drive.

install_steps.title: Create Save File
install_steps.detail_md: Puppy can save changes to a file on existing partition. Creates persistent system without full installation.
